text.section:
A policy or contract of motor vehicle insurance may not be canceled or nonrenewed solely because of:
the age of the holder of the policy or contract; or
the physical handicap or disability of the holder of the policy or contract.

The premium for a policy or contract of motor vehicle insurance may not be increased solely because:
an insured under the policy or contract is older than 65 years of age; or
the holder of the policy or contract has a physical handicap or disability, unless there is actuarial justification for the increase.
